messages.title: VOTE PAT CLEARY FOR YOUR MP
messages.content: My vision is for a Birkenhead that is both prosperous and green. Birkenhead has enormous potential. But, for decades under the Labour party and the previous MP, that potential has remained untapped and our town has suffered badly. That has to change. I’m proud that, at the local level, the Green Party has ended the days of one-party rule in Birkenhead. That has forced the council to pay us far more attention. We now need the same energy and the same fresh thinking from a new MP with a proven track record of achievement for Birkenhead.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Planned regeneration of Birkenhead town centre has now moved to a fresh stage of consultation aimed at revising and sharpening the emerging masterplan.
Green councillors have won council support for more 20mph zones.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In the 2019 local elections last May, the Green Party won almost one-third of the vote across the whole of Birkenhead. This makes Greens easily the biggest challenger to Labour.

community.content: Mersey Park is to receive some much needed investment. There will be a new activity trail, nature and planting areas. Improvements will be made to the multi-use games area, railings, entrances and signage around the play area.

politicalExperience.achievements: Pat Cleary is your Green candidate for the general election

images.caption: Emily at Mersey Park which is set to benefit from new investment
Emily, Pat and Steve visit the new “Refresh” furniture upcycling shop on St Anne Street
Green councillors have won council support for more 20mph zones
Steve Hayes, Emily Gleaves and Pat Cleary campaign all year round for you
Emily, Pat and Steve on Milton Pavement. This part of town is now under council control and should form the hub of the town centre regeneration scheme.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Election leaflets funded by Green Party

examples: Birkenhead has enormous potential. But, for decades under the Labour party and the previous MP, that potential has remained untapped and our town has suffered badly.
In the 2019 local elections last May, the Green Party won almost one-third of the vote across the whole of Birkenhead.
My vision is for a Birkenhead that is both prosperous and green.
This makes Greens easily the biggest challenger to Labour.
If you want fresh thinking, fresh ideas and fresh energy then please vote for Pat Cleary on December 12th.
Pat Cleary has a proven track record for Birkenhead
Town Centre Regeneration: Planned regeneration of Birkenhead town centre has now moved to a fresh stage of consultation.
Green councillors have won council support for more 20mph zones.
